org.jlab.coda.et

Class EtSystemOpenConfig

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jlab.coda.et.EtSystemOpenConfig

  • public class EtSystemOpenConfig
extends java.lang.Object
    This class defines a set of configuration parameters used to open an ET system.
    Author:
    Carl Timmer

    • Constructor Detail

      • EtSystemOpenConfig

        public EtSystemOpenConfig()
        No arg constructor. Will broadcast to local subnet addresses, but ET name and host need to be set explicitly.

      • EtSystemOpenConfig

        public EtSystemOpenConfig(java.lang.String etName,
                          java.lang.String hostName,
                          java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> bAddrs,
                          java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> mAddrs,
                          boolean remoteOnly,
                          int method,
                          int tPort,
                          int uPort,
                          int ttlNum,
                          int policy)
                   throws org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtException
        Most general constructor for creating a new EtSystemOpenConfig object.
        Parameters:
        etName - ET system name
        hostName - may open an ET system on the given host which could be the: 1) actual ET system's host name, 2) dotted decimal address of ET system's host, or 3) general location of ET system such as EtConstants.hostAnywhere, EtConstants.hostLocal, or EtConstants.hostRemote
        bAddrs - collection of broadcast addresses (as Strings) to broadcast on in order to find ET system. If = null, set to list of all local subnets' broadcast addresses.
        mAddrs - collection of multicast addresses (as Strings) to multicast to in order to find ET system. If = null, set to default which is a list containing only EtConstants.multicastAddr = 239.200.0.0.
        remoteOnly - true if talking to ET system only through sockets (as if remote), or false if also using JNI/shared memory for talking to local C-based ET systems
        method - means used to contact an ET system over the network: EtConstants.broadcast, EtConstants.multicast, EtConstants.direct, or EtConstants.broadAndMulticast
        tPort - TCP server port number of the ET system. If = 0, set to default which is EtConstants.serverPort = 11111.
        uPort - UDP port number for broadcasting or sending udp packets to known hosts. If = 0, set to default which is EtConstants.udpPort = 11111.
        ttlNum - Time-to_live value for multicasting. If = 0, set to default which is 32.
        policy - policy on what to do about multiple responding ET systems to a broadcast or multicast: EtConstants.policyFirst, EtConstants.policyLocal, or EtConstants.policyError
        Throws:
        org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtException - if null, blank, or too-long etName; if null or blank hostName; if method value is not valid; if method is direct and no actual host name was specified; if port numbers are < 1024 or > 65535 (except if = 0 which uses default value); if ttl is < 0 or > 254; if policy value is not valid

      • EtSystemOpenConfig

        public EtSystemOpenConfig(java.lang.String etName,
                          java.lang.String hostName)
                   throws org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtException
        Constructor for broadcasting on all subnets. First responder is chosen.
        Parameters:
        etName - ET system name
        hostName - may open an ET system on the given host which could be the: 1) actual ET system's host name, 2) dotted decimal address of ET system's host, or 3) general location of ET system such as EtConstants.hostAnywhere, EtConstants.hostLocal, or EtConstants.hostRemote
        Throws:
        org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtException - if args are null or blank;

      • EtSystemOpenConfig

        public EtSystemOpenConfig(java.lang.String etName,
                          int uPort,
                          java.lang.String hostName)
                   throws org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtException
        Constructor for broadcasting on all subnets. First responder is chosen.
        Parameters:
        etName - ET system name
        uPort - UDP port number to broadcasting to. If = 0, set to default which is EtConstants.udpPort = 11111.
        hostName - may open an ET system on the given host which could be the: 1) actual ET system's host name, 2) dotted decimal address of ET system's host, or 3) general location of ET system such as EtConstants.hostAnywhere, EtConstants.hostLocal, or EtConstants.hostRemote
        Throws:
        org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtException - if no broadcast addresses were specified; if port number is < 1024 or > 65535

      • EtSystemOpenConfig

        public EtSystemOpenConfig(java.lang.String etName,
                          int uPort,
                          java.lang.String hostName,
                          java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> bAddrs)
                   throws org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtException
        Constructor for broadcasting on given subnets. First responder is chosen.
        Parameters:
        etName - ET system name
        uPort - UDP port number to broadcasting to. If = 0, set to default which is EtConstants.udpPort = 11111.
        hostName - may open an ET system on the given host which could be the: 1) actual ET system's host name, 2) dotted decimal address of ET system's host, or 3) general location of ET system such as EtConstants.hostAnywhere, EtConstants.hostLocal, or EtConstants.hostRemote
        bAddrs - collection of broadcast addresses (as Strings) to broadcast on in order to find ET system. If = null, set to list of all local subnets' broadcast addresses.
        Throws:
        org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtException - if no broadcast addresses were specified; if port number is < 1024 or > 65535

      • EtSystemOpenConfig

        public EtSystemOpenConfig(java.lang.String etName,
                          java.lang.String hostName,
                          java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> mAddrs,
                          int mPort,
                          int ttlNum)
                   throws org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtException
        Constructor for multicasting. First responder is chosen.
        Parameters:
        etName - ET system name
        hostName - may open an ET system on the given host which could be the: 1) actual ET system's host name, 2) dotted decimal address of ET system's host, or 3) general location of ET system such as EtConstants.hostAnywhere, EtConstants.hostLocal, or EtConstants.hostRemote
        mAddrs - collection of multicast addresses (as Strings) to multicast to in order to find ET system. If = null, set to default which is a list containing only EtConstants.multicastAddr = 239.200.0.0.
        mPort - Port number to multicast to. If = 0, set to default which is EtConstants.udpPort = 11111.
        ttlNum - Time-to_live value for multicasting. If = 0, set to default which is 32.
        Throws:
        org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtException - if no multicast addresses were specified; if port number is < 1024 or ^gt; 65535; if ttl is < 0 or > 254

      • EtSystemOpenConfig

        public EtSystemOpenConfig(java.lang.String etName,
                          java.lang.String hostName,
                          int tPort)
                   throws org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtException
        Constructor for connecting directly to tcp server. First responder is chosen.
        Parameters:
        etName - ET system name
        hostName - ET system host name
        tPort - TCP server port number of the ET system. If = 0, set to default which is EtConstants.serverPort = 11111.
        Throws:
        org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtException - if no actual host name was specified; if port number is < 1024 or > 65535

        Constructor to create a new EtSystemOpenConfig object from another.
        Parameters:
        config - EtSystemOpenConfig object from which to create a new configuration

        public void setHost(java.lang.String hostName)

        Parameters:
        hostName - system host name or broad/multicast destination

      • setNetworkContactMethod

        public void setNetworkContactMethod(int method)
                             throws org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtException
        Sets the means or method of contacting an ET system. Its values may be EtConstants.broadcast for broadcasting, EtConstants.multicast for multicasting, EtConstants.direct for connecting directly to the ET tcp server, and EtConstants.broadAndMulticast for using both broadcasting and multicasting.
        Parameters:
        method - means or method of contacting an ET system
        Throws:
        org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtException - if the argument has a bad value

      • setResponsePolicy

        public void setResponsePolicy(int policy)
                       throws org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtException
        Sets the policy on what to do about multiple responding ET systems to a broadcast or multicast. The possible values are EtConstants.policyFirst which chooses the first ET system to respond, EtConstants.policyLocal which chooses the first local ET system to respond and if none then the first response, or EtConstants.policyError which throws an EtTooManyException exception.
        Parameters:
        policy - policy on what to do about multiple responding ET systems
        Throws:
        org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtException - if the argument has a bad value or if the policy says to choose a local ET system but the host is set to chose a remote system.

      • setUdpPort

        public void setUdpPort(int port)
                throws org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtException
        Sets the UDP port number for broad/multicasting and sending udp packets to known hosts.
        Parameters:
        port - UDP port number for broad/multicasting and sending udp packets to known hosts; set to 0 for default = EtConstants.udpPort.
        Throws:
        org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtException - if the port number is < 1024 or > 65535

      • setTcpPort

        public void setTcpPort(int port)
                throws org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtException
        Sets the TCP server port number of the ET system.
        Parameters:
        port - TCP server port number of the ET system; set to 0 for default = EtConstants.serverPort.
        Throws:
        org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtException - if the port number is < 1024 or > 65535

      • setTTL

        public void setTTL(int ttlNum)
            throws org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtException
        Sets the time-to-live value for multicasting.
        Parameters:
        ttlNum - time-to-live value for multicasting (-1 < ttl < 255); set to 0 for default = EtConstants.multicastTTL.
        Throws:
        org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtException - if the port number is < 0 or ^gt; 254

      • setNetworkInterface

        public void setNetworkInterface(java.lang.String networkInterface)
                         throws org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtException
        Set the network interface (in dotted-decimal format) used for connecting to the ET system. The interface may be specified by giving a specific IP address or a broadcast (subnet) address. If it is a broadcast address, it will convert that to the specific IP associated with it in other parts of the code.
        Parameters:
        networkInterface - the network interface used for connecting to the ET system, or null if none specified. Address may be either a specific or broadcast IP dotted-decimal.
        Throws:
        org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtException - if the interface is not in dotted-decimal format or is an invalid IP address.

      • setTcpSendBufSize

        public void setTcpSendBufSize(int tcpSendBufSize)
                       throws org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtException
        Set the TCP send buffer size in bytes. A value of 0 means use the operating system default.
        Parameters:
        tcpSendBufSize - TCP send buffer size in bytes
        Throws:
        org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtException - if the argument is less than 0

      • setTcpRecvBufSize

        public void setTcpRecvBufSize(int tcpRecvBufSize)
                       throws org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtException
        Set the TCP receive buffer size in bytes. A value of 0 means use the operating system default.
        Parameters:
        tcpRecvBufSize - TCP receive buffer size in bytes
        Throws:
        org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtException - if the argument is less than 0

      • setNoDelay

        public void setNoDelay(boolean noDelay)
        Set the TCP no-delay setting. It is off by default.
        Parameters:
        noDelay - TCP no-delay setting
